hypothesis_content.title: Failed Rally Fade - High Volume Rejection at Key Moving Average
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL/BEAR regime, when BTC rallies intraday to touch or exceed its 50-day MA but closes near the low of the day (lower 25% of daily range) on above-average volume (>1.2x 20-day avg), it signals a failed breakout and predicts negative momentum for the next 2 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A rejection at a key moving average (50-day MA) with weak closing price and high volume indicates strong selling pressure and exhaustion of buying momentum. This 'upthrust' or failed breakout pattern often leads to a short-term continuation of the prior downtrend or consolidation.
entry_conditions: Daily close is in the bottom 25% of the day's range ( (Close - Low) / (High - Low) ≤ 0.25 )

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2 days after entry OR -4% price move in favor, whichever comes first

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Average 2-day forward return after signal entry is ≥ 0%, indicating the rejection did not lead to continued negative momentum.
